description.narrative: Communities and families in priority regions,especially the most disadvantaged women and children, have increased goods and services for sustainable access to clean water and basic sanitation and adopt appropriate hygiene and environmental practices.

mailing-address.narrative: BP 96 Niamakoro Route de l'Aeroport Bamako

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in peri-urban and urban communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

title.narrative: Mali United Nations Development Assistance Framework Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Mali: Evaluation de la Réponse Humanitaire de l’UNICEF à la Crise Malienne 2013-2017
2019 Mali: Evaluation formative des stratégies de renforcement des capacités au Mali 2015-2019
Mali 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Mali Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and families in priority regions,especially the most disadvantaged women and children, have increased goods and services for sustainable access to clean water and basic sanitation and adopt appropriate hygiene and environmental practices.
Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
